terms.definition: Technical documentation that explains how to use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface, including endpoints, parameters, and code examples
Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, and troubleshoot a product, including user guides, technical specifications, and tutorials
A centralized online platform where users can access, search, and navigate through organized documentation and information resources
Command-Line Interface - a text-based interface that allows users to interact with software by typing commands rather than using a graphical interface
A technology that packages applications and their dependencies into lightweight, portable containers that can run consistently across different computing environments
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access different versions and collaborate effectively
An HTML element that embeds another document or webpage within the current page, commonly used to integrate external content
Formatted sections in documentation that display programming code with syntax highlighting and often include copy-paste functionality
Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interface - a web service architecture that uses standard HTTP methods for communication between systems
terms.expanded: Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interface

terms.definition: An organized list of sections and subsections in a document that provides navigation links to help users quickly find specific information
A method of formatting text using special codes or tags to indicate how content should be displayed, such as making text appear as inline code
Written materials specifically designed to help end-users understand and effectively use a product or service
Technical documentation that describes the architecture, components, and internal workings of a system, typically intended for developers and administrators
Highlighted sections in documentation that draw attention to important information, warnings, tips, or additional context using visual formatting
Interactive elements in documentation that allow external content like videos, code snippets, or other media to be integrated directly into the page
